Putin's choice of a long war in Ukraine
description: The suspension of American aid to Kyiv fits neatly into the Russian leader's military plans: to intensify his offensive in Ukraine this summer, and to sustain an endless conflict, now synonymous with the survival of his regime through a newfound 'stability' built on a war economy.

Netanyahu says Trump meeting could 'advance' Gaza deal ahead of Doha talks
description: Under mounting pressure to end the war, the Israeli prime minister is due to meet with President Trump on Monday: 'We are working to achieve this deal that we have discussed, under the conditions that we have agreed to.'

headline: Macron heads to UK for first official visit of King Charles III's reign
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte are to arrive at Windsor Castle on Tuesday for the first state visit of the reign of King Charles III. Macron will also address UK MPs during a three-day visit expected to improve a Franco-British relationship strained by Brexit.

headline: In Bosnia and Herzegovina, stone treasures, canyons and cypress trees await
description: The Balkan country, with its painful past, is rich in historical sites and mountainous landscapes − from the Kravica Waterfalls to the Olympic sites of Sarajevo, from a medieval fortress to Tito's bunker.

headline: The relentless rush to build dams in China's Tiger Leaping Gorge: 'If we lose our land, we lose everything'
description: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (5/6). In the far Southwest of China, plans to build massive reservoirs as part of hydroelectric dam projects have condemned dozens of mountain villages to disappear.

Iranian photographer Forough Alaei portrays life during the war: 'Nothing will ever be the same again'
description: After the first Israeli bombings in Iran, Iranian photographer Forough Alaei left Tehran to take refuge with her family on the Caspian Sea coast. She documented those days when war plunged them into the unknown.

headline: Starlink: The newest asset for rebel and jihadist groups in West Africa
description: Billionaire Elon Musk's satellite internet system has become an increasingly common tool for armed groups to communicate in areas lacking traditional land-based communications infrastructure.

headline: In the jaws of the Jackal: How an informant orchestrated a policewoman's fall
description: Sonia C. was still a law enforcement officer when, in April 2024, she was sentenced to three years in prison for handing police files to an informant known as the Jackal. The former officer, who loved to party until dawn and used cocaine, still pleads that she was too naïve.
